tit.cmt: 「Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Haruhito」 ⇒ 『Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Haruhito』に変更しました。

sen.j: 閑院宮美仁親王（かんいんのみや はるひとしんのう、宝暦7年11月25日 (旧暦)（1758年1月4日） - 文政元年10月6日 (旧暦)（1818年11月4日））は、江戸時代の皇族。
sen.e: Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Haruhito (January 4, 1758 – November 4, 1818) was a member of the Imperial family in the Edo period.
Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Haruhito (January 4, 1758 – November 4, 1818) was a member of the Imperial family who lived in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: ・「Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Haruhito」 ⇒ 『Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Haruhito』に変更しました。・「the Imperial family in the Edo period」 ⇒ 『the Imperial family who lived in the Edo period』に修正しました。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Haruhito (January 4, 1758 – November 4, 1818) was a member of the Imperial family who lived in the Edo period.
He was a danjoin (President of the Board of Censors).
He was a danjoin (President of the Board of Censors).
He was a danjoin (President of the Board of Censors).
He was a Keko Goin.
sen.cmt: 「華光五院」正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: He was a Keko Goin.
He was a Keko Goin.

sen.j: 世襲親王家、閑院宮第3代当主。
sen.e: He was the third family head of the Kanin no Miya family, the hereditary house of prince.
He was the third family head of the Kanin-no-miya family, the hereditary house of prince.
sen.cmt: 「the Kanin no Miya family」 ⇒ 『the Kanin-no-miya family』に変更しました。
sen.e: He was the third family head of the Kanin-no-miya family, the hereditary house of prince.

sen.j: 宝暦13年（1763年）に親王宣下、明和5年（1768年）に元服。
sen.e: He was given the title of Imperial Prince in 1763 and celebrated his coming of age in 1768.
He was given the title of Imperial Prince in 1763 and celebrated his coming of age in 1768.
He was given the title of Imperial Prince in 1763 and celebrated his coming of age in 1768.
He became Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince) in 1815.
He became Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince) in 1815.
He became Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince) in 1815.

sen.j: 歌道に造詣が深く、歌人の日野資矩などとも交流があった。
sen.e: He had deep knowledge on poems, and had cultural exchange with poets such as Suketsune HINO.
He had deep knowledge on poems, and had cultural exchange with poets such as Suketsune HINO.
He had deep knowledge on poems, and had cultural exchange with poets such as Suketsune HINO.
Genealogy
Genealogy
Genealogy
His father was Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Sukehito.
His father was Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Sukehito.
sen.cmt: 「Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Sukehito.」 ⇒ 『Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Sukehito』に変更しました。
sen.e: His father was Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Sukehito.

sen.j: 生母は大中臣氏祐智の娘。
sen.e: His real mother was a daughter of Suketomo from the Onakatomi clan.
sen.cmt: 「祐智」正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: His real mother was a daughter of Suketomo from the Onakatomi clan.
His real mother was a daughter of Suketomo from the Onakatomi clan.

sen.j: 御息所は関白近衛内前の娘、藤原因子。
sen.e: His Miyasundokoro (Lady of the Bedchamber) was FUJIWARA no Inshi, a daughter of Uchisaki KONOE, a chief advisor to the Emperor.
His Miyasundokoro (Lady of the Bedchamber) was FUJIWARA no Inshi, a daughter of Uchisaki KONOE, a chief advisor to the Emperor.
His Miyasundokoro (Lady of the Bedchamber) was FUJIWARA no Inshi, a daughter of Uchisaki KONOE, a chief advisor to the Emperor.
His son was Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Tatsuhito.
His son was Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Tatsuhito.
sen.cmt: 「Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Tatsuhito」 ⇒ 『Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Tatsuhito』に変更しました。
sen.e: His son was Imperial Prince Kanin-no-miya Tatsuhito.
The Emperor Kokaku was his younger brother.
The Emperor Kokaku was his younger brother.
The Emperor Kokaku was his younger brother.
